ticket.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes
ticket.original-body:
There's some strange problem with find_or_create_by on has_many associations and protected attributes: user.posts.find_or_create_by_some_protected_attribute doesn't assign "some_protected_attribute", but user.posts.find_or_initialize_by_some_protected_attribute does.
I'm attaching a failing test case.
ticket.latest-body:
There's some strange problem with find_or_create_by on has_many associations and protected attributes: user.posts.find_or_create_by_some_protected_attribute doesn't assign "some_protected_attribute", but user.posts.find_or_initialize_by_some_protected_attribute does.
I'm attaching a failing test case.
ticket.original-body-html:
There's some strange problem with find_or_create_by on has_many associations and protected attributes:
user.posts.find_or_create_by_some_protected_attribute doesn't assign "some_protected_attribute", but user.posts.find_or_initialize_by_some_protected_attribute does.

I'm attaching a failing test case.

version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body: I'm having this problem as well. No luck tracking it down so far - ActiveRecords's association internals are a mystery to me.
version.body-html: I'm having this problem as well. No luck tracking it down so far - ActiveRecords's association internals are a mystery to me.
version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body:
It looks like find_or_create through an association calls create_by with a Hash: https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f967b352d2abdb88b704266cdb06b53f7d8ab401#diff-1
...and attributes are protected when creating from Hashes: https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f967b352d2abdb88b704266cdb06b53f7d8ab401#diff-1
version.body-html:
It looks like find_or_create through an association calls create_by with a Hash:
https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f967b352d2abdb88b704266cdb06b...

...and attributes are protected when creating from Hashes: https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f967b352d2abdb88b704266cdb06b...
version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body: ack. Ignore me, I'm looking in the wrong place.
version.body-html: ack. Ignore me, I'm looking in the wrong place.
version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body: I'll take a look at it over the weekend, but the workaround that I'm using for now is find_or_initialize_by + save.
version.body-html: I'll take a look at it over the weekend, but the workaround that I'm using for now is find_or_initialize_by + save.

version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body:
I don't think that it is a bug (for 2.3.10 and 3.x). Here: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/lib/active_record/base.rb#L293 says that protected attributes won't be set unless they are given in a block.
Also the same says about find_or_initialize_ so if it works for such methods it is a bug.
version.body-html:
I don't think that it is a bug (for 2.3.10 and 3.x). Here: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/lib/active... says that protected attributes won't be set unless they are given in a block.

Also the same says about find_or_initialize_ so if it works for such methods it is a bug.
version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes
find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body: Also I wrote a test for 2.3.10 and 3.0.3 for find_or_initialize_ and it also fails as it should be. So I don't think that there is any bug.
version.body-html: Also I wrote a test for 2.3.10 and 3.0.3 for find_or_initialize_ and it also fails as it should be. So I don't think that there is any bug.

Thanks 2kan.
(This is a change in behavior from 2.2.x)
version.body-html:
Thanks 2kan.

(This is a change in behavior from 2.2.x)
version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body:
First of all it's not a change in behavior from 2.2.x, but from 2.3.5 - I migrated my app from 2.3.5 directly to 2.3.10 and it stopped working.
Second thing is that find_or_initialize_by_id works fine. Here's code from my app:
@@@ ruby r = current_user.relationships.find_or_initialize_by_contact_id(1) => #<Relationship id: nil, user_id: 15, contact_id: 1, blocked: false, created_at: nil, updated_at: nil, inverse_id: nil, state: "unapproved", requested_at: nil, approved_at: nil> r.save => true
r = current_user.relationships.find_or_create_by_contact_id(1) WARNING: Can't mass-assign these protected attributes: contact_id => #<Relationship id: nil, user_id: 15, contact_id: nil, blocked: false, created_at: nil, updated_at: nil, inverse_id: nil, state: "unapproved", requested_at: nil, approved_at: nil> @@@
so the behavior is inconsistent.
version.body-html:
First of all it's not a change in behavior from 2.2.x, but from 2.3.5 - I migrated my app from 2.3.5 directly to 2.3.10 and it stopped working.

Second thing is that find_or_initialize_by_id works fine. Here's code from my app:

r = current_user.relationships.find_or_initialize_by_contact_id(1)
=> #<Relationship id: nil, user_id: 15, contact_id: 1, blocked: false, created_at: nil, updated_at: nil, inverse_id: nil, state: "unapproved", requested_at: nil, approved_at: nil>
r.save
=> true

r = current_user.relationships.find_or_create_by_contact_id(1)
WARNING: Can't mass-assign these protected attributes: contact_id
=> #<Relationship id: nil, user_id: 15, contact_id: nil, blocked: false, created_at: nil, updated_at: nil, inverse_id: nil, state: "unapproved", requested_at: nil, approved_at: nil>

so the behavior is inconsistent.
version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body: @2kan: thanks for the link! It turns out that the bug is actually that find_or_initialize_by works with protected attributes in 2.3.10, although it shouldn't :)
version.body-html: @2kan: thanks for the link! It turns out that the bug is actually that find_or_initialize_by works with protected attributes in 2.3.10, although it shouldn't :)
version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body: @Szymon Nowak I will check again how find_or_initialize_by works in 2.3.10 to be sure that there is a bug and gonna try to patch it so.
version.body-html: @Szymon Nowak I will check again how find_or_initialize_by works in 2.3.10 to be sure that there is a bug and gonna try to patch it so.
version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body:
Hm! Look here: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/test/cases/finder_test.rb#L849 Funny, isn't it? I think that it is a bug, I think that find_or_initialize_by should work as find_or_create_by and as it says in docs, shouldn't it?
But look here: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/test/cases/finder_test.rb#L889
Isn't it messy? I was really surprised reading the code and tests. I can write any patch doing something with it but i have no idea how _must_ it work. Maybe we just should not touch this.
version.body-html:
Hm! Look here: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/test/cases... Funny, isn't it? I think that it is a bug, I think that find_or_initialize_by should work as find_or_create_by and as it says in docs, shouldn't it?

But look here: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/test/cases...

Isn't it messy? I was really surprised reading the code and tests. I can write any patch doing something with it but i have no idea how must it work. Maybe we just should not touch this.
version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes

version.body:
Ok, so to sum it all up:
The docs for both methods (https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/lib/active_record/base.rb#L294 and https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/lib/active_record/base.rb#L305) state that: Protected attributes won't be set unless they are given in a block.
However, in the tests ((https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/test/cases/finder_test.rb#L849) the behavior is different: test_find_or_initialize_from_one_attribute_should_set_attribute_even_when_protected test_find_or_create_from_one_attribute_should_set_attribute_even_when_protected
The other thing is how both methods work with has_many associations:
@@@ ruby r = current_user.relationships.find_or_initialize_by_contact_id(1) => #<Relationship id: nil, user_id: 15, contact_id: 1> r.save => true
r = current_user.relationships.find_or_create_by_contact_id(1) WARNING: Can't mass-assign these protected attributes: contact_id => #<Relationship id: nil, user_id: 15, contact_id: nil> @@@
While all the links above point to files in 2.3.10 release, it seems that the same mess is in 3.0.2 release. I hope that someone from the Rails core team can decide how it should actually work :)
version.body-html:
Ok, so to sum it all up:

The docs for both methods (https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/lib/active... and https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/lib/active...) state that:

Protected attributes won't be set unless they are given in a block.

However, in the tests ((https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v2.3.10/activerecord/test/cases...) the behavior is different:

test_find_or_initialize_from_one_attribute_should_set_attribute_even_when_protected
test_find_or_create_from_one_attribute_should_set_attribute_even_when_protected

The other thing is how both methods work with has_many associations:

r = current_user.relationships.find_or_initialize_by_contact_id(1)
=> #<Relationship id: nil, user_id: 15, contact_id: 1>
r.save
=> true

r = current_user.relationships.find_or_create_by_contact_id(1)
WARNING: Can't mass-assign these protected attributes: contact_id
=> #<Relationship id: nil, user_id: 15, contact_id: nil>

While all the links above point to files in 2.3.10 release, it seems that the same mess is in 3.0.2 release. I hope that someone from the Rails core team can decide how it should actually work :)
version.title: find_or_create_by doesn't work with protected attributes
